result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph G Schmitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph G Schmitt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph G Schmitt in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 day time served, with Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 14 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program, and a course in anger management.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Amy M. unless approved by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant to continue in currently enrolled programs and to discuss those with their agent.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
Received and Filed, two letters on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Joseph G Schmitt in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph G Schmitt in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 38 on 8-14-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Amy M., no weapons in possession and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

15RM027492  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/31/2015

15RM027491  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/31/2015
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-18-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  Amy M.    AND/OR   her residence     AND/OR    her place of employment

No dangerous weapons
No firearms

Defendant Joseph G Schmitt in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-104

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 04.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/1/15 @ 1:30pm
